snippet: A rising chorus of critics say the Communist Party’s agenda is not visionary enough to handle China’s looming crises and set the nation on the path to stability.
abstract: Rising chorus of critics within Chinese elite are expressing doubt that 91-year-old Communist Party's authoritarian system can deal with stresses bearing down on nation; criticisms are being leveled even as Communist Party's once-in-a-decade transfer of power indicates little change in government's policies. (Series: Changing of the Guard)
lead_paragraph: A rising chorus of critics say the Communist Party’s agenda is not visionary enough to handle China’s looming crises and set the nation on the path to stability.

headline.seo: Chinese Communist Party Faces Calls for Democracy
headline.main: Amid Calls to Open China’s Politics, Party Digs In
headline.print_headline: Party Digs In Amid Calls to Open China’s Politics
